title: Playful creature happily bounces on a trampoline as a jealous dog watches on
text:
An adorable fox has the time of its life bouncing on a trampoline in a garden looking just like the John Lewis's 2016 Christmas advert.

The footage of the animal, captured in Tyresö, Sweden on October 2, shows it jumping up and down on the apparatus that is buried in the ground.

In the 2016 John Lewis Christmas advert, a pair of cheeky foxes playfully enjoy a garden trampoline, before being joined by a variety of other woodland creatures.

Footage captured in Sweden shows a playful fox bouncing on a trampoline. The fox springs up and down a few times, enjoying its new toy

In this video, the fox can be seen gingerly taking one jump on the trampoline.

It then confidently springs up a few more times in succession, enjoying its new toy.

The animal bounces around in one spot, before taking a short break.

It then springs over to the other side of the trampoline and lies down there too.

All the while, a jealous dog can be heard whining in the background.

The animal springs up and down on the trampoline, enjoying its new toy. This draws comparisons to a John Lewis Christmas advert from three years ago

Tired out: The animal bounces around a few more times in one spot, before taking a short break. It then bounds over to the other side of the trampoline and lies down there too

This draws comparisons to a John Lewis Christmas advert from three years ago.

In the promotional video, Buster the Boxer longingly gazes at two foxes who spring up and down on a trampoline in the family's garden.

As more woodland animals join in, Buster growls in jealously.

When the doors open on Christmas morning, Buster bounds out of the house and jumps up onto the trampoline himself.

He gleefully bounces as his shocked owners look on.

In the promotional video, Buster the Boxer longingly gazes at two foxes who spring up and down on a trampoline in the family's garden
description: The footage, captured in Tyresö, Sweden, shows the creature springing up and down on the apparatus. This is just like John Lewis's 2016 Christmas advert Buster the Boxer.
